column4: Hello, any one know how to solve the "ignoring unknown interface" issue? in ubuntu 10.04, the network connection worked great, then sudenly i lost all the NICs and when i try to restart the network service i get this message, when i look in the interfaces file there is only "auto lo and iface lo inet loopback", ps i installed ssh on the machine, but i don't think that is the problem....i couldn't find any real answer over the web fo
it.....please help
how did you connect to internet before?
you connected through wired or wireless?
could you please put my name to the beginning of your messages so I can see when you respond to me?
okay, firstly, is the network-manager applet working? the one that scans for the wireless and whatnot
i think every thing is working, what i am getting from the dasktop is i can see all the wireless networks around me...and i can connect to them, just not getting any ip from that
and it stays at that point, and doesn't progress, right?
yes
mm hmm, let me think, I am afraid I might not be very helpful now though
ok, 10x anyway, as i said, i read over the web that many poeple has the same problem, wierd no one know how to fix it and what do they do, install all the ubuntu from scratch?
I too had a similar problem but I don't use gnome's network manager, so I wouldn't really know
sorry, how do i fix it in shell?
Use "wicd-curses" in that case. is it installed?
i have no idea...son't know that...checking
type "whereis wicd-curses"
getting wicd-curses:
I fixed my problem, 10x, can u please tell me what does dhclient mean?....10x :-)
I really odn't know. How did you solve your problem?
, sudo dhclient wlan0
soory, again, om the server and every thing is working
you could do "man dhclient" and see what it's about.
got it...just say what you expect, dynamic configure of the NIC :-)
